intro: Philodendron maximum, commonly known as the giant philodendron, is a climbing plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that can grow up to 3 feet in length. The plant has a vigorous growth habit and can reach heights of over 20 feet in its natural habitat. Its stems are typically aerial, allowing it to climb trees and other structures. Philodendron maximum thrives in bright, indirect light and requires consistent moisture and high humidity to flourish.
